cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 495 miles east of the north-western Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow and turn westward toward the north-western Bahamas Tuesday, then continue west-south-west and make landfall along the east-central Florida coast late Wednesday before crossing the peninsula toward the eastern Gulf of Mexico and the Big Bend coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (near or north of West Palm Beach–Volusia/Brevard County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the Volusia/Brevard County Line south to Hallandale Beach FL including Lake Okeechobee; Tropical Storm Watch from Altamaha Sound GA south to Volusia/Brevard County Line and Hallandale Beach to north of Ocean Reef; Storm Surge Watch Altamaha Sound GA to Hallandale Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Bahamas, entire Florida Peninsula (both east and west coasts), south-east Georgia and portions of the south-east U.S. coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (no guidance yet for west-central FL)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt gusts) possible Thursday with 46% cumulative probability and up to 13% chance of reaching 50 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No specific surge guidance issued for Tampa Bay yet; any surge currently expected to remain below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6-inch maxima possible Thursday–Friday as the center crosses the peninsula.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands; rough seas and hazardous marine conditions in and near Tampa Bay beginning late Wednesday.
